extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite  CLST200/3.0 or CLST201/3.0 or CLST207/3.0 or CLST208/3.0 or CLST214.

basic.description: A study of how the human body is viewed in ancient medical theory and practice. Readings of ancient medical texts will explore how the human body is constituted, how it relates to the world, what the role of the physician was seen to be in prevention and treatment of disease, and how illness and healing were understood in ancient Greece and Rome.
basic.subject: CLST
basic.title: Doctor, Bloodletter, Surgeon: The Beginnings of Western Medicine
